scenario:
Wedbush analyst Dan Ives has been a prominent bull in the artificial-intelligence (AI) rally, predicting a 25% increase in tech stocks for 2025. Ives' previous predictions, including a 20% gain in 2023 and a 25% gain in 2024, were accurate. He believes the AI boom will drive a multiyear rally in the stock market, similar to the dot-com boom of the 1990s.

Key drivers of the AI rally include rapid growth in revenue and profit for stocks like Nvidia, as well as the increasing demand for AI components from cloud infrastructure companies such as Microsoft, Alphabet, and Amazon. Ives also notes that the departure of Lina Khan as head of the Federal Trade Commission may lead to a more favorable regulatory environment for big tech companies.

However, investors should be cautious due to the high valuations of tech stocks, with the Nasdaq trading at a price-to-earnings ratio of 35 and many individual stocks, such as Apple, trading at inflated valuations. A better strategy for investors may be to tactfully invest in the industry, either by waiting for pullbacks in specific stocks or using ETFs to diversify risk.
